intro: Phyteumoides, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in a head. The plant produces achenes, which are small, dry fruits with a pappus that aids in wind dispersal. Phyteumoides species are often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. They have a cosmopolitan distribution and are adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
